glosses: To be afraid and leave; to take one's tail between one's legs.

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish قویروغی قیصمق (ḳuyruġı ḳıṣmaḳ, “to fear, to move away in fear”), equivalent to kuyruk (“tail”) + -u (possessive suffix) + -(n)u (accusative suffix with "n" as buffer consonant) + kısmak (“to pinch, to squeeze”), literally “to squeeze or pinch one's tail”. Cognate with Azerbaijani quyruq qısmaq, Kazakh құйрығын қысу (qūiryğyn qysu).
